Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient: The student shows most elements clearly and correctly with some minor gaps.
CAN: The student can draw two distinct habitats, one clearly on land and another in water, demonstrating an understanding of different environments.
The student can include a variety of living things in each habitat, such as trees, bushes for land habitats, and fish and clams for water habitats, although the variety may not be extensive.
The student can depict specific animals typically found in each habitat, like lizards or squirrels for land and fish for aquatic environments, though might miss a few expected species.
The student can show an attempt to compare plant and animal diversity between the two habitats, with some elements depicted clearly.
CANNOT: The student might not be able to accurately label all species depicted or may leave some without labels, indicating a gap in vocabulary or specific identification.

The student might inconsistently show clear differentiation between the kinds of plant life between the two habitats, perhaps mixing some characteristics of plants between habitats or omitting less common ones.
